newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA ASKS TO EXTEND DEBT REPAYMENT TO POLAND.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA ASKS TO EXTEND DEBT REPAYMENT TO POLAND.

text.p: Bulgaria will ask Poland to extend a July 31 deadline for clearing outstanding debt under previous counter trade agreements until the year-end, trade minister Valentin Vassilev said on Thursday.

"Our agreement with Poland on clearing outstanding debt worth 100 million transferable roubles with Bulgarian exports expires on July 31, but we can clear the debt by the end of the year," Vassilev told reporters after the cabinet's meeting.
Transferable roubles were used to settle counter-trade between former communist block countries. Their exact equivalent in dollars is agreed on bilateral basis.

Bulgaria owed Poland some 600 million transferable roubles in underlivered goods after the demise of the communist trade block COMECOM seven years ago. The clearing deadline was extended several times in the past years.
Bulgarian exports consist of mainly machinery, wine and farm produce, the trade ministry said.

Bulgaria hopes to sign a free trade accord with Poland this year in a bid to boost bilateral trade and help it in its move to join the Central European Free Trade Agreement (CEFTA), but clearing outstanding debts is one of the pre-conditions.
